review_title: A Great Place to Grow as a Student
job_title: Supplemental Instruction Leader in Oceanside, CA
pros: Teaching is a great way to solidify your understanding of a topic. And all of the SI staff are incredibly supportive.
cons: Monthly meetings with all of the SI staff can feel tedious.

review_title: Great Students, Great Colleagues, Sweet Deal if Full-Time
pros: There are a lot of nice students Lots of great colleagues who love to teach
cons: Associate faculty members are mistreated. There is a lack of accountability for administrators and full-time The President speaks of her commitment to adjuncts, yet there is so much fear of retaliation that employees are afraid to bring up significant issues. The enrollment is down as compared to every other college in the county, yet the administration boasts of how well they are doing. Other colleges have given faculty some funds from the COVID infusion, and MCC has given very little to faculty and staff. Grant funds that have been awarded have had to be returned because of lack of accountability.

pros: The coaches are nice and helpful, if you can't help tutoring something you can just tell them you don't understand, very understanding overall. Also, very flexible with your schedule.
cons: I don't really have any cons.

pros: To be a student worker at MiraCosta was a fantastic opportunity to understand professional life. I got involved in different projects and events that allowed me to begin building my resume in a professional environment.

job_title: Assistant Preschool Teacher in Oceanside, CA
pros: This position is highly sought out by individuals looking to hone their reaching skills. MiraCosta College’s Early Childhood Education is one of the best and the internship program available on the school’s campus provides an experience where mentors are available and willing to bring out your best teaching skills.
cons: Only downside I can say is the pay, however the benefits of working in a state job and in an atmosphere where there is such a high level of support and encouragement outweighs the low pay.

pros:
Very flexible hours for students
Fair pay
Fulfilling work
cons: As a Writing Consultant, you will feel like you matter to your supervisors. Know that they will let go of you without hesitation and in an extremely unprofessional manner. I worked there for over 2 years and I was sent a generic, cookie-cutter template of an email saying that they no longer needed me, and that was that. I would have appreciated it if they did this more professionally given the time and effort I put forth. Prior to being let go, it became apparent that this is not uncommon with the number of employees that would just stop showing up due to "unknown reasons".

cons: Moving to different departments is very easy but moving up the ladder is hard. Not to mention, the pay doesn't match San Diego's living costs. Even with a college degree

pros: You get the taste of both worlds… Welding while teaching.
cons:
Poorly structured welding program, unorganized and very little support from the upper management. 
Marketing team needs to step it up to the premium package so they are not asking the teachers to post a week before the class needs to be filled. 
Program head/ management should have a bit more knowledge in welding so as to understand when we don’t have gas or materials in a timely manner means we have to pivot for an already jam packed schedule.
More room for advancement in the trade with some type of incentive for continued education for the instructors.

review_title: Great staff that puts students first

Learning environment that facilitates self improvement and skill development.
Very flexible around student's schedules.
 Frequent trainings to better prepare student tutors.

Limited hours.
No other cons really.

pros:
Chill environment and coworkers
Awesome work environment location near the beach 
Safe Space
cons: No room for growth in my career situation. But otherwise would love to continue working here.

pros: As faculty you can run your class and content your way.  Pretty hands off management style.
cons:
Extreme favoritism when it comes to getting full time status.

They pretty much let anyone come in and teach on a part time basis, but when it comes to the hiring process for full time it’s like you are running for a political office....long and tedious process and at the end if somebody very high up wants you, then you are in.

It’s pretty sad because the part time faculty teach most of the classes, but receive 1/5 of full time pay.  And even if they aren’t qualified to teach, they take you because in the long run nobody can last on the petty pay.... so the great part time faculty who in a lot of cases are more skilled than full time ones end up leaving & the students end up getting substandard education.

Also, NO HR engagement on career paths for part time faculty.  Even if you are doing stellar work, they never ask how they can help you establish a long term career either in teaching or other roles.  So, talented people that they need to nurture and keep get frustrated with the process and leave.   Very sad!!!!!!

review_title: The MLC is nice and welcoming
pros:
Small gifts on B-day
Supervisor and colleagues are very nice and willing to help
cons: No obvious downsides at all

pros: Everyone on staff is kind and welcoming. Higher ups are eager to help, supportive, and easy to get in touch with. The pay is competitive. You have full control of your classroom. The campus is beautiful. I truly love it here and I am so thankful.
cons: You get very little when it comes to benefits as an adjunct. You also are limited to how many courses you can teach. This means that you end up having to work at more than one school in order to make ends meet. All of this is true at nearly every college which leave adjuncts with limited benefits and pretty low pay overall. MiraCosta also follows LHE to determine pay/hours which is confusing and difficult to calculate. There does not seem to be many fulltime positions available. Each department only has a handful of full time faculty and a majority of courses are taught by adjuncts. It's honestly a great place, I just wish there was more for adjuncts.

review_title: Best pay for adjunct instructors in SoCal; little to no support from full-time faculty and dept chairs
pros:
In one word: money!  If you are adjuncting, you cannot beat the pay.  They are current on their technology and you have access to various teaching modalities - all which can help your overall instruction and potential advancement.
The student population is comprised of mostly hard-working, capable individuals and it was a pleasure to interact with them.
cons: I found a lack of support, comraderie, and overall friendliness from their full-time professors.  If you are an adjunct there, you are definitely a second class citizen.  They also relied heavily on student evaluations when any seasoned instructor knows these are often not an adequate portrayal of a teacher's strengths and weaknesses, but more of a reflection of the writer's performance in the class.  That is to say, students earning high grades tend to ascribe more favorable traits to their professor than students who are not achieving high marks.

pros: Nice people, collaborative environment, mission/purpose of the organization
cons: NO in-office perks for employees (you want water/coffee to drink during the day, you better bring it with you from home), Internal systems are severely outdated, No internal process documentation...very unorganized, Prepare to hit the ground running when hired - there is no initial orientation or training and the pressure is high. Be prepared to put in long days.

pros: Great Summer Job it allows you to gain great customer service experience.This job also allowed me to realize what a real 40 hour a week job really was like. Also it allowed me to have a good paying job with the experiences that I actually had.
cons: The job is only seasonal and the only way to move up is to have a masters degree that allows you to be the supervisors of the camp.  Also the job would be very challenging at times, but sometime the job was very boring and was not exciting.

review_title: The most beautiful learning experience of my life.
pros: MiraCosta cares about their staff and students by employing students to offer a wealth of services such as free math tutoring and free food on Thursdays. My superiors were reliable, competent, and lenient.
cons: The students, to whom you will undoubtedly provide services, can be ungrateful and impatient largely depending on their age. The hours are often limited because of budget cuts.

review_title: Great Place to Work Until Retirement
pros: My first week on the job, everyone kept coming up to me and saying how nice it was to meet me. Everyone made me feel like they had finally accomplished filling in a void in the team.
cons: There isn't a really close place to eat, so unless I bring something, I have to go to the really really pricey cafeteria.

pros: Flexible hours, excellent pay for a job on a college campus for college students; excellent management and support for all employees.
cons: Working with students can be frustrating, but also very rewarding.  The cliché "You get out of it what you put into it" applies to the job.

review_title: A fun atmosphere to work while a student at MiraCosta.
job_title: Computer/Java Lab Aide in Oceanside, CA
pros: Work hours are not bad, and the job is not stressful. You usually work with a handful of coworkers with shared responsibility. Being a Java lab aide is good since you can do more than just help with general computer questions. Also, if you're a student, you can do homework when there isn't much to do.
cons: Work there is reinforcing of prior knowledge, but not too challenging.

pros: Open sharing of financial information to the college employees and active support of staff & faculty in continuing education. Excellent benefits & pay. Work with a purpose -- providing an excellent education at a reasonable price.
cons: Very competitive application process, but worth the effort. This applies to all types of positions. Of course, culture varies across departments, and movement up and across departments is tough.

pros: Professional hiring process, good base pay, union for part-time employees, modern and updated classrooms and offices, and a pleasant work culture.
cons: Student enrollment seems to be dropping, which means part-time employees may not be given many (if any) classes. Overheard two full-time teachers laughing about how part-timers think they'll get a full-time job eventually but the school always hires outside new PhD grads instead.

pros: Flexible. You get to choose your own hours and subject(s) to tutor. The staff is very kind. Sometimes there are free snacks.
cons: Sometimes there are not enough stem tutors and it gets crowded and loud. But that's what makes the environment fun and challenging to work in and you feel rewarded helping students.

pros: The availability of learning anything just by asking any of the professors. The youthful feel of being around the students
cons: The annual reminder that because of budget cuts your job can be next...

review_title: Great place for students to work
pros: All of my coworkers and supervisors were great, very relaxed environment in the tutoring center. Very flexible work schedule. I got to pick my own hours and balance with my class schedule.
cons: Not really any downsides working in the tutoring center.

pros: Staff and Faculty recognize they work for a great institution and feel a sense of pride to be a part of it.
cons: As an adjunct counselor your salary is not at the top of the nation or state, as full-time salaries are.
